title: How to Remove Unnecessary Audio with Audacity

steps.title: Select a background noise section of the track.
steps.content: Select a background noise section of the track. Click and drag your mouse across a section of the track that contains only background noise if possible. If there isn't enough free track to do this, select the section with the most noticeable background noise.

steps.title: Click Effect.
steps.content: Click Effect . This tab is at the top of the Audacity window (Windows) or the top of the screen (Mac). Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Noise Reduction….
steps.content: Click Noise Reduction… . It's near the middle of the Effect drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Get Noise Profile.
steps.content: Click Get Noise Profile . This button is at the top of the window. This will help Audacity determine what is background noise and what isn't.

steps.title: Select the section of the track that you want to clean up.
steps.content: Select the section of the track that you want to clean up. You can also click the track and then press either Ctrl + A (Windows) or ⌘ Command + A (Mac) to select the whole track, which is ideal if you're working with a song.

steps.title: Click Effect, then click Repeat Noise Reduction.
steps.content: Click Effect , then click Repeat Noise Reduction . It's at the top of the drop-down menu. This will apply the suggested noise reduction to the track.

steps.title: Reduce the noise again if necessary.
steps.content: Reduce the noise again if necessary. Repeat the noise removal process if there's still a noticeable amount of background noise. You may have to do this several times. You can raise the amount of background noise removed by clicking Noise Reduction... in the drop-down menu and then sliding the "Noise reduction" slider to the right.

steps.title: Select a section of your project.
steps.content: Select a section of your project. Find a section you want to remove, then click and drag your mouse across it to highlight it.

steps.title: Press Delete.
steps.content: Press Delete . This will immediately remove the section from Audacity. You can also click Edit and then click Delete in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select the whole track.
steps.content: Select the whole track. Click the audio track, then press either Ctrl + A (Windows) or ⌘ Command + A (Mac). This wikiHow guide can help you learn more about recording a full song in Audacity.

steps.title: Click Effect.
steps.content: Click Effect . It's a tab at the top of the window (Windows) or screen (Mac).

steps.title: Scroll all the way down and select Vocal Remover….
steps.content: Scroll all the way down and select Vocal Remover… . You may have to click a downward-facing arrow at the bottom of the drop-down menu to find this option. Selecting it prompts a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click a vocal remover plugin.
steps.content: Click a vocal remover plugin. Click a link in the pop-out menu to the right of the drop-down menu. This will open the vocal remover window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Doing so will remove some of the vocals from the track. While this isn't 100 percent reliable, you'll notice a significant difference in the result. You can perform this step multiple times to increase the percentage of vocals removed, though doing so may harm the recording's fidelity.
